meanings.sent1: The Smith family invited the Durning family to their party.
meanings.sent2: Many people share the same Durning last name.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, the Durning clan wore matching t-shirts.
meanings.sent4: The Durning family tree has deep roots in this town.

meanings.definition: Durning (adjective): Of or relating to the actor Charles Durning.
meanings.sent1: The Durning movie marathon featured all of Charles Durning's films.
meanings.sent2: Fans of Charles Durning appreciate his Durning performances.
meanings.sent3: The Durning memorabilia collection included signed photos and posters.
meanings.sent4: Her acting style was often described as Durning-like.
meanings.sent5: The Durning tribute honored the actor's legacy.

meanings.sent1: She was durning the cookies in the oven when the timer went off.
meanings.sent2: The chef was durning the sauce to perfection.
meanings.sent3: The cat was durning around the house, chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The dancers were durning gracefully across the stage.
meanings.sent5: The children were durning with excitement at the circus.
